document_data.name: Crossed Quills House
document_data.services:
Scribing, accounting, record-keeping
"Shadow work" (false accounting, keeping two sets of books, creating false documents)
document_data.mainbody: The '''Crossed Quills House''' was the guildhall for the [[Guild of Clerks and Scribes]] that operated within the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]]. It was located on the corner of [[DeVillars Ride]] and [[Raven Way]] within the [[Altarside]] of the city's [[Temple District (Ravens Bluff)|Temple District]].
document_data.Description:
The doors of the Crossed Quills had archways that were adorned with sculptures of [[raven]]s holding onto open books. It was flanked by a number of long, narrow windows with relief carvings of crossed [[quill]]s above them. The open book carvings were a source of curiosity and intrigue among the residents of Altarside. 

It was local tradition for Ravenian children to climb up the archways to read what was written within the books, and the more agile [[rogue]]s and adventurers in the city would scribe [[chalk]] messages to one another within their pages.
